page.title: 14CHERRY BURTON-SEAMAN 1
page.content: I have lived in Cherry Burton for the last ten years and am married with two children.I am 39 yrs.old and have been going to sea since 1963,having held a British Foreign Cargo Masters Certificate since August 1972.Having spent two years at the John Bright Grammar School at Llandudno I won a scholarship in 1961 to the HMS Conway M.N.Cadet School on Anglesey,after which I joined Alfred Holt & Co. of Liverpool(Blue Funnel Line).In 1973 I joined North Sea Ferries.After my first command in 1978 the company reduced its fleet with the sale of the Norsky in 1980 and as junior Captain I had to step down and sail as Chief Officer/Relief Master,a position I still hold today (commanding the Norwave on the Hull/Zeebrugge Service) In 1982 at the outbreak of the Falklands conflict I was sailing(CONT)
